page.title: 06EDUCATION IN BURNESTON AREA
page.content: In Burneston, just opposit the church, there is a little group of old buildings. There is a row of alms houses with the original school joined on. The schoolmaster used to live in a room upstairs. The schoolroom was converted into a kitchen for school meals later on. Next door there is the Old School which was built in 1852, and was in use even after the new school was opened in 1974. There was not enough room in the new school so the infants worked there. When the number of pupils dropped then the Old School was not used any more, until the Nursery School opened in 1984. Children who attend Burneston come from Melmerby, Wath, Middleton Quernhow, Sutton Howgrave, Norton Conyers, Kirklington, Carthorpe, Burneston, Theakstone and Exelby.
